thread.title: Still unwell, Queen Elizabeth misses New Year church service
thread.title_full: Still unwell, Queen Elizabeth misses New Year church service

title: Still unwell, Queen Elizabeth misses New Year church service
text:
Still unwell, Queen Elizabeth misses New Year church service 46 reading now twitter TWEET More 
London: The Queen missed a New Year's Day church service on Sunday due to a heavy cold, Buckingham Palace said, a week after the 90-year-old monarch missed a Christmas Day service for the first time in decades . 
The world's longest-reigning monarch, who became unwell before Christmas, stayed indoors at her Sandringham country estate in Norfolk, eastern England, while other members of the royal family attended the service. Migrants attempt to storm Spanish enclave Play Video The Queen misses second public event The Queen misses second public event 
Queen Elizabeth II misses the New Year's church service, a week after she missed the Christmas service due to a heavy cold. Up Next Migrants attempt to storm Spanish enclave Play Video Migrants attempt to storm Spanish enclave Migrants attempt to storm Spanish enclave 
Around 1100 African migrants attempt to enter Europe by storming the border fence between Morocco and the Spanish enclave of Ceuta. Up Next UN council endorses Syria ceasefire Play Video UN council endorses Syria ceasefire UN council endorses Syria ceasefire 
The United Nations Security Council votes to endorse the ceasefire in Syria's civil war brokered by Russia and Turkey. Up Next North Korea close to test of ICBM Play Video North Korea close to test of ICBM North Korea close to test of ICBM 
North Korean leader Kim Jong Un says that the isolated nuclear-capable country is close to test-launching an intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM). Up Next Hollywood sign changed to 'Hollyweed' Play Video Hollywood sign changed to 'Hollyweed' 
California residents awoke in 2017 to the iconic Hollywood sign changed to 'Hollyweed'. Up Next Gunman shoots 15 in Brazil's New Year massacre Play Video Gunman shoots 15 in Brazil's New Year ... Gunman shoots 15 in Brazil's New Year massacre 
At least eleven people are dead after a gunman opened fire at a New Year's celebration in Campinas, Brazil. Up Next North Korea calls nuclear program 'righteous self-defence measure' Play Video North Korea calls nuclear program ... North Korea calls nuclear program 'righteous self-defence measure' 
North Korean Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho tells the United Nations his country's decision to strengthen its nuclear weapons capability in spite of U.N. condemnation was a "righteous self-defence measure" and that it would not abandon its deterrence while it was threatened by nuclear-armed states. More videos The Queen misses second public event 
Queen Elizabeth II misses the New Year's church service, a week after she missed the Christmas service due to a heavy cold. 
"The Queen does not yet feel ready to attend church as she is still recuperating from a heavy cold," Buckingham Palace said in a statement. 
The Queen and her husband Prince Philip, 95, were both suffering from heavy colds in the week leading up to Christmas and delayed their journey from London to Sandringham by a day, travelling there by helicopter on December 22. Related Content Kate and William spend Christmas with the Middletons 
The prince attended both the Christmas and New Year services. On Sunday he arrived by car before walking into the grey stone parish church of St Mary Magdalene, but the Queen, who is the symbolic head of the Church of England, made no public appearance. 
A few dozen parishioners and a crowd of photographers had gathered outside the church on Sunday morning in cold, rainy weather as other members of the royal family arrived. Advertisement 
The Queen's daughter, Anne, and her third son, Edward, were among those who attended. 
The Queen had previously attended the Christmas service at the church every year since the royal family started celebrating Christmas at Sandringham in 1988. SHARE
